title: Authors and Citation
text: Kenny C (2025). typr: Write Render 'Typst' Documents. R package version 0.0.1, http://christophertkenny.com/typr/.
code: @Manual{,   title = {typr: Write and Render 'Typst' Documents},   author = {Christopher T. Kenny},   year = {2025},   note = {R package version 0.0.1},   url = {http://christophertkenny.com/typr/}, }

title: Write and Render Typst Documents
text: goal typr render Typst documents R. default, try use Typst CLI. Typst CLI installed, try use Quarto, bundles Typst.

title: Write and Render Typst Documents
text: can install development version typr GitHub :
code: # install.packages('pak') pak::pak('christopherkenny/typr')

title: Write and Render Typst Documents
text: following example shows use typr render Typst document. can take path file lines use. , pass lines compile: Example image generated code
code: library(typr)  doc <- c(   '#set page(height: auto, width: auto)',   '= Example Doc',   'Some text' )  typr_compile(doc, output_format = 'png') #> C:/Users/chris/AppData/Local/Temp/Rtmpeow7sK/filea881b5c2983.png

what: Find if Typst is available — has_any_typst
title: Find if Typst is available — has_any_typst
Find if Typst is available — has_any_typst
code: has_any_typst()  has_typst_cli()  has_quarto_typst()  has_quarto_cli()  typr_has_typst()  typr_has_quarto()  typr_has_quarto_typst()

title: Find if Typst is available — has_any_typst
Find if Typst is available — has_any_typst
code: has_any_typst() #> [1] FALSE has_typst_cli() #> [1] FALSE has_quarto_cli() #> [1] FALSE has_quarto_typst() #> [1] FALSE

title: Compile a Typst document — typr_compile
code: typr_compile(   input = NULL,   output_file = NULL,   output_format = c("pdf", "png", "svg", "html"),   typst_args = NULL )

title: Compile a Typst document — typr_compile
text: input either path .typ file text use file output_file file output output_format format use. One c('pdf', 'png', 'svg', 'html'), typst_args Additional arguments pass Typst. Can listed typr_help('compile')

title: Compile a Typst document — typr_compile
code: if (FALSE) { # has_any_typst() typr_compile('hello world') typr_compile(   input = 'Hello world', output_format = 'png',   typst_args = c('--ppi', '300') ) }

title: List Available Typst Fonts — typr_fonts
code: typr_fonts()

title: List Available Typst Fonts — typr_fonts
code: if (FALSE) { # has_any_typst() typr_fonts() }

what: Get Help Information for a Typst command — typr_help
title: Get Help Information for a Typst command — typr_help
text: Prints message terminal help information. Silently returns content character can printed cat().

title: Get Help Information for a Typst command — typr_help
code: typr_help(command = NULL)

title: Get Help Information for a Typst command — typr_help
text: command name command get help , e.g. 'compile'

title: Get Help Information for a Typst command — typr_help
Get Help Information for a Typst command — typr_help
code: if (FALSE) { # has_any_typst() typr_help('compile') }

what: Create a project from a template — typr_init
title: Create a project from a template — typr_init
Create a project from a template — typr_init
code: typr_init(template = NULL, version = NULL, dir = NULL, typst_args = NULL)

title: Create a project from a template — typr_init
text: template template use, can local Typst Universe. string specify @preview @local, '@preview' prepended. version version string, e.g. 0.1.0 dir project directory typst_args Additional arguments pass Typst. Can listed typr_help('init')

title: Create a project from a template — typr_init
Create a project from a template — typr_init
code: if (FALSE) { # has_any_typst() typr_init('charged-ieee', dir = paste0(tempdir(), '/typr_example')) }

what: Query within a Typst file — typr_query
title: Query within a Typst file — typr_query
Query within a Typst file — typr_query
code: typr_query(   input = NULL,   selector = NULL,   typst_args = NULL,   as_json = !rlang::is_installed("jsonlite") )

title: Query within a Typst file — typr_query
text: input path .typ file selector string search , e.g. "<label>" typst_args Additional arguments pass Typst. Can listed typr_help('query') as_json TRUE, return list, otherwise character string

title: Query within a Typst file — typr_query
text: length one character json syntax !as_json, otherwise list

title: Query within a Typst file — typr_query
code: if (FALSE) { # has_any_typst() tf <- fs::file_temp(ext = 'typ') writeLines(text = '= test <lbl>', con = tf) typr_query(input = tf, selector = '<lbl>') }

title: Get installed Typst version — typr_version
code: typr_version(keep_hash = FALSE)

title: Get installed Typst version — typr_version
code: if (FALSE) { # has_any_typst() typr_version() }

title: Watch a Typst document — typr_watch
code: typr_watch(   input = NULL,   output_file = NULL,   output_format = c("pdf", "png", "svg", "html"),   typst_args = NULL )  typr_watch_stop()

title: Watch a Typst document — typr_watch
text: input either path .typ file text use file output_file file output output_format format use. One c('pdf', 'png', 'svg', 'html'), typst_args Additional arguments pass Typst. Can listed typr_help('watch')

title: Watch a Typst document — typr_watch
code: if (FALSE) { # has_any_typst() tf <- fs::file_temp(ext = 'typ') writeLines(text = '= test', con = tf) typr_watch(tf) writeLines(text = c('= test', 'hello'), con = tf) }

what: Identify Install Typst to Use — typr_which_typst
title: Identify Install Typst to Use — typr_which_typst
Identify Install Typst to Use — typr_which_typst
code: typr_which_typst()

title: Identify Install Typst to Use — typr_which_typst
Identify Install Typst to Use — typr_which_typst
code: typr_which_typst() #> NULL
